name: Klein et al. - 2024 - Source Tracing of Audio Deepfake Systems.grobid.tei.xml

segments.content: propose a more generalizable approach by classifying the vocoder used in the spoofing system . authors inexplore classifying both the acoustic model and the auxiliary classifier in asvspoof 2019 la: conversionfigure .
d-to-end (e2e) approach takes an existing cm architecture and trains the whole model for each of the multi-class component classification tasks separately, as depicted in the top part of fig.
vspoof 2019 la dataset has three independent partitions: train, development, and evaluation . mlaad consists of tts attacks only, but it includes 52 different state-of-the-art spoofing algorithms .
d whisper based models are fine-tuned on asvspoof and mlaad datasets in their respective experiments . the best model is chosen based on dev set accuracy and average f1-score .

paper, we propose three multi-class classification tasks to give more explanatory predictions in the place of traditional binary spoof detection: input-type, acoustic model, and vocoder classification . on our mlaad protocol which includes a greater number of vood and avaostic categories from more modern tts systems, our resnet (e2e) model yields an average f1 score of 82.3% . a potential area
